attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Stamp duty on buying UK shares is levied by the Treasury at 0.5%. 

Of the world’s financial capitals, only London carries such a burdensome rate of tax. The UK also has by far the highest rate among the G7 nations. US investors pay just 0.0003%. 

Germany, Italy and Japan don’t charge stamp duty at all.

It is absolutely essential for British prosperity that we should be fully competitive in taxation on finance and business.

Stamp duty on share purchases blunts UK competitiveness.  It also imposes an unfair and unnecessary burden on UK private investors.

We therefore call on the Prime Minister to abolish stamp duty on buying shares.
